p: We were prevented from conducting quantitative meta-analysis due to heterogeneity among study populations, incomparability among integrated care models, few comparable studies, and different outcomes measures. Consequently, all studies were assessed qualitatively. All relevant quantitative outcomes of interest were assessed where appropriate. Odds ratio (OR) or relative risk (RR) with 95% confidence intervals, probability measures (p–values), and descriptive analyses of outcomes of interest were referred if it was stated in the articles. For comparison, we chose to categorize the included studies into two groups based on whether the participants’ received opioid agonist treatment (OAT) or not.
